alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central El Paso County; Western El Paso County (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 07 at 4:11AM CDT until July 09 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT SATURDAY NIGHT... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, temperatures of 105 to 108 degrees. For the Excessive Heat Watch, dangerously hot conditions with temperatures near 110 degrees possible. * WHERE...Western El Paso County and Eastern/Central El Paso County. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until midnight MDT Saturday night. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from late Saturday night through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heat advisories and possibly warnings will likely need to be extended through much of next week as this prolonged period of hot temperatures is expected to continue.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.

area.areaDesc: Eastern, Central El Paso County; Western El Paso County
